metadata.name: AI Brain Scheme #69
metadata.description:
Simple project using trigonometry, recursive function 
and simple geometry shapes to create an imaginary AI Brain Scheme

You can download the large image to see the small detail.

---
Features : 
AI Grid Configurator : True/False
AI Extra Brain Chips : True/False
Ai Binary Dreams Code : True/False
Photonic Wire : True/False

AI Level : 9 Levels (Very Small AI-Small AI-Medium AI-Medium x2 AI-Large AI-Large x2 AI-Impossible AI-Insane AI-Quantum Level AI)
"Quantum Level AI" = super rare

Color Schemes : red,blue,green
---
Unlimited colors palette
---
Press [p] to save captured image to png (3300pxx4500px)
---
Created using vanilla javascript
KrouniHatim - Oct22
---
(CC BY-ND 4.0)

metadata.name: The Restoration Scheme: The Birth #53
metadata.description:
“The Birth” is the second episode of “The Restoration Scheme” Series. The work was based on Acropora intermedia. 

It’s a day after the full moon when the corals spawn simultaneously.

——

“The Restoration Scheme” Series
It’s a virtual action extended from the coral restoration plan led by Delta Electronics Foundation from Taiwan, consisting of five generative corals. Each of them was based on five different species of coral as the theme.
If collectors mint virtual corals, Delta Electronics Foundation will drop coral seedlings collectively in the sea. 

The project is powered by FAB DAO (Formosa Art Bank). The split will donate to the local organization from Taiwan dedicated to the coral restoration scheme.

——

About Delta 
Climate change is causing irreversible impacts. Coral reefs, known for their rich biodiversity and the capability to nourish a quarter of marine life, are at the forefront of the crisis. Also known as "tropical rainforests" in the sea, coral reefs have experienced five mass bleaching events in the past five years. Once global warming exceeds the 2˚C threshold, it's likely that 99% of coral reefs will die off worldwide.

In addition to launching a coral restoration initiative along the northeast coast of Taiwan, Delta Electronics Foundation collaborates with Asia University to host "Earth Pulsing: Nurturing Life Exhibition" and releases the first art NFT featuring coral restoration. Through these actions, we hope to evoke public awareness of ecological issues. For more information, please visit https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

——

Features

Depth: 6m, 12m, 18m
Corals: 1 ~ 8
Special: -

double click or press 's' to save as an image
made with p5.js and chroma.js

____________________________

《誕生》為《恢復方案》系列第二作，品種為中間軸孔珊瑚。

這是發生在滿月後的某一天，珊瑚集體產卵的日子。

——

《恢復方案》
恢復方案是虛擬演算珊瑚實驗，一系列共五件的生成珊瑚作品，每一件對應到特定珊瑚物種。本實驗與台達電子文教基金會合作，藏家每收藏一件 NFT，台達電子文教基金會就會實際在海中植下一株對應的珊瑚苗。這項專案與 FAB DAO （福爾摩沙藝術銀行）支援鑄造，部分分潤將直接捐助給台灣在地珊瑚保育組織，詳細資訊將於 FAB DAO Twitter 公佈。

——

關於台達電子文教基金會氣候變遷引發許多不可逆的環境衝擊，以豐富生物多樣性著稱、滋養四分之一海洋生物的珊瑚，便是首當其衝的受害者。
被譽為「海中熱帶雨林」的珊瑚生態系，已在最近五年遭遇三次大白化，一旦升溫跨越攝氏2℃，屆時恐有多達99％的珊瑚瀕臨滅絕。
近年在東北角投入珊瑚復育的台達電子文教基金會，今年與亞洲大學共同策畫「地球˙脈動中」生態與藝術特展，並合作發行全台首見的珊瑚生成藝術NFT，喚起社會大眾對生態議題的重視。更多資訊可參考: https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

metadata.name: Crash Euphoria #60
metadata.description:
My first foray into shaders and GLSL: This piece experiments with layering many textures guided by an underlying pattern. Each pixel value dictates which pattern is displayed. There are varying levels of imperfections in each pattern, some choose a single color, some use a color guide pattern, some individual strokes decide on another color altogether. These layers are compiled in a shader and warped.

Press 's' in live view to save a png

Created with p5.js and chroma.js

metadata.name: Commune #46
metadata.description:
A minimalist composition with a nod towards architecture.

2932 bytes of Vanilla JS.

For more info, see article linked below: Me, Commune, Etc.

In live mode:
’S’ : save as svg (without grain)
‘P’ : save as png (3780x2673)

URL params in live mode:
‘g=n’ : no grain
‘g=w’ : wood grain
‘h=t’ : high resolution mode, 7560 × 5346 (Chrome only)

After rendering with these params, tapping 'P' will then save the png with those settings applied.

metadata.name: Elo #18
Holons #144
metadata.description:
Everything is divisible. Larger organisms are made up of smaller ones, entire galaxies are comprised of stars, planets, people, dust, and one effect here and now ripples into eternity. Nothing exists without the elemental components that have evolved to make them possible — and nothing on the plane of existence arrives in isolation from something greater. This enmeshed reality is the concept of a Holon: a whole that is simultaneously part of another whole. 

As cells, energies, beings, and ideas grow in complexity, each new advancement includes and transcends their holons, the very catalysts of evolution. What does this essential process look like on its own when scale, context, and definition are removed? The senses are forced to purely observe the present interactions and reactions that occur between all parts. This is what Holons attempts to portray — the witnessing of birth, formation, and crystallization simultaneously. 

Upon viewing each piece and inspecting its detail with curiosity — we can observe living reality that has been temporarily suspended from motion and artificially stopped for us to witness. Can we see what is a part, and what is a whole? Can we define what these holons are? 

Let each Holons remind us that the impossible can always be made; let each one be nothing and everything — organisms, cosmos, energy itself — all at once, for it’s the creation of something entirely new that best reminds us that everything is actually made of the parts already here. So, remember to create without barriers or limitations because reality itself is made of that which lives now only in imagination.


--------

TENDER x flight404
October 2022

Press ‘h’ in live view to render a high resolution version of any token.
Press ‘s’ in live view to save a .png of the current view of any token.

Holons was created in vanilla Javascript and WebGL, but the majority of the work was done in GLSL shaders. This setup was substantially assisted by fx(hash) community leader and artist Liam Egan who provided technical assistance and emotional support during the project's lifespan. For this reason, we have included him in the split of proceeds.

metadata.name: Stairway to Even #66
metadata.description:
Always an even number of steps, going up or down, sometimes tilted and the stairs are gone.

Glitch happens, but what are the odds of getting an odd?

Made with p5js, FettePalette and 🤍 by David Esq.

metadata.name: Crude Acceptance #81
metadata.description:
It was there when we arrived
    No owners, no gatekeepers
    The opportunity to explore
    The chance to transform
    What we are
    What we see
    And a trace will came with us
    And that way it will multiply
    As long as we allow
    To leave here a part of us
    It will be there when we leave
    No owners, no gatekeepers
    But itself



  Controls
  Format:
  'f' - switch square/full screen format

  View:

  'Arrow Up/Down' - Decrease/Increase distance to origin
  'Mouse Drag' - View Rotation


  Export:
  'x' - show/hide export menu
  'm' - quick canvas save


Created with p5.js (Javascript + GLSL) by Victor Doval @vicdoval (2022)
Designed to be seen in Google Chrome 102.0.5005.63

metadata.name: Elswhere #54
metadata.description:
Perlin noise walks into a Julia set and finds itself Elswhere. X is real, Y is imaginary, or is it the other way around? 

Elswhere is a unique generative art series in which noise and fractal math are combined to create whimsical shapes and motifs, with an infinite number of variations. Made with p5js.

For each pixel, the noise values corresponding to the X and Y coordinates are computed and then used as the real and imaginary components for initializing a Julia set recursion. The pixel is colored based on the number of steps it takes for the recursion to reach its base case.

Keyboard controls:
[S] Save the current view.
[2] Render 2000x3000px image.
[4] Render 4000x6000px image.
[6] Render 6000x9000px image.

Created by Elsif, 2022.05

metadata.name: Thunderclap #96
metadata.description: Generative irregular tiling with cute patterns by @legoushque

metadata.name: Unicorn #8431
metadata.description:
All of us have dreams, and everyone would like to meet a fairy, a genie, a wizard, or someone else who will make our dreams come true in a snap of a finger or with the wave of a wand. But we're the only ones who can do it. We are those magical unicorns, unique, inimitable, with our own qualities and magical abilities.
These unicorns are the visualization of our inner selves that makes our dreams come true. An embodiment of all the best with a huge positive magical power.

Twitter: @unicorn_nft_art
Web: https://unicorn-nft.web.app/

by @lucky26puch, @AgataBaranova17
Made in 2022

License: CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: Paesaggio #63
metadata.description:
In this work I used the tools I learned in developing precedent works to generate a landscape with hills, flowers, streams, ruins, sky and clouds. The generated landscape gives the impression of a natural one but at the same time it has some "abstract" traits that reveal the geometrical properties of the noise generation process. This noise is used both for the morphological aspect and for colors assignment.

Developed with p5.js using WEBGL renderer.
Rendering is faster with chrome browser.

[s] to save a 1600x1600 png.


Features:
"Palette": 12 colormap
"Sky":  Day, Night, Gray - 15% Gray, 20% Night, 65% Day
"Ruins": True, False - 33% True
"Streams": True, False - 33% True
"Flower": Red-Blue, Fuchsia-Yellow, Rose-Violet
"Border": True, False - 25% True


Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Merkki #34
metadata.description:
Merkki is an exploration of primitive forms, randomness and bold lines.
Drawing inspiration from mid-70s iconic single-color logotypes, this project revolves heavily around constraints and minimalism.

- 5 different shape types
- 3 grid sizes
- Mostly monochrome, with occasional color accents

Press “s” to save a 4000x4000px image.

metadata.name: Cosmic Type #194
metadata.description:
Cosmic Type is a kinetic type experiment that explores both graphic space as structural and semantic agency. Inspired by the early pioneering work of the concrete poets such as Dom Sylvester Houédard, Ian Hamilton Finley and Steve McCaffe, the project is a play with letters, words and graphic form in the computational and generative space.

Each iteration gives you the possibility to discover a variety of visual form through exploring the system. Please explore your iteration with the key interactions below. It is hoped that you give the time to explore and observe. If you don't, you may end up with just a blank canvas. 

Thank you for collecting. 

Key Interactions

‘a’ activates forward motion on/off
‘b’ activates backward motion on/off
‘r’ rotates grid 45° [ rotates on key pressed]
‘f’ rotates the grid freely [ stops on key release ]
‘p’ switches grid scale on/off [ this can be CPU heavy on older machines ] 
‘g’ extra glyphs on/off
‘q’ return to the initial state 


Program written by Mark Webster
Font is copyright ©simonrenaud

areafour.xyz
@motiondesign_01

metadata.name: Bound #72
metadata.description:
Knots bind and hold, mark time, and unite. But the power of a well-tied knot isn't only to fasten – it also symbolizes how tightly one holds their pledges. Whether a commitment to a partner, community, or oneself – the longevity of a deeply held bond is often marked with a symbol of passing time, like knots tied in a rope.

Let these ropes remind us of the binds we hold – new ones, lengthy ones, unbreakable ones, and even those we’ve had to untie. In plain view, these knots invite us to contemplate what our bonds mean to us, and to see them anew.

---

Press ‘1’-’9’ to increase resolution
Press 's' to save an image of the output at the current resolution

Created with p5.js
For third party license information, please see license.md

---

TENDER x David Brice Allen
July 2022

objkt.name: THE WORD AFTER US: An AI poetry unreading #202

metadata.name: THE WORD AFTER US: An AI poetry unreading #202
metadata.description:
“Where in the world will words go, 
after us? How will they be arranged, 
and what will they sound like
when they arrive at their destination?
What will they be doing?
What will the world be doing?
Will the words be quiet or loud?
Will they be full of themselves,
or full of longing,
or full of longing’s opposite?”
 
An ars poetica on the future of literature and humanity. 
 
This project is a one-time generative poetry performance of a transhuman text by Sasha Stiles and her AI alter ego, Technelegy – read and unread by an algorithm authored by Nathaniel Stern. Every hash transforms one of 353 lines of AI-written poetry from legible letters into wordless language, generating a unique textblock from millions of possible combinations; each algorithmic translation unwrites itself, forever. Press "s" to overlay and toggle the original line of verse, and watch its shapes and meanings degenerate – or evolve – into an infinite visual poem.
 
All minters will receive an airdropped broadside (mp4) of the entire original poem after the performance is complete. A 1/1 media-rich audiovisual version of THE WORD AFTER US will also be made available.

 
Poetic traits:
- 353 possible lines of generative poetry produced by a GPT-3 language model fine-tuned on Stiles’ and Stern’s writing and research.
- 28 possible color palette combinations selected from Stern’s performative scanner art, with rare palettes including RGB, Hacker, Charcoal, and Chalkboard (black background).
- 6 possible fonts, including the premiere of Stern and Stiles’ custom AI font, NNFT (Neural Network Font Type), developed for their ongoing collaboration, “Mother Computer.”
- millions of layout and layering possibilities, including a rare “spiral” effect.
- billions of animation attribute combinations, which carry on forever.

issuer.name: THE WORD AFTER US: An AI poetry unreading
